channel.title: Comments on: Corona Geek #131 – Walter Luh on Corona Free and Game Design Part 3 – Creating Walls

item.title: By: Anna
item.dc:creator: Anna
item.description: how do I connect a replay button and how to connect the replay button to the game
item.content:encoded: how do I connect a replay button and how to connect the replay button to the game

item.title: By: Adi
item.dc:creator: Adi
item.description: Matt, I think there is or was such a section. I used to post my first games there. It would have been great if they could simply pull from our app list on the stores.
item.content:encoded: Matt, I think there is or was such a section. I used to post my first games there. It would have been great if they could simply pull from our app list on the stores.

item.title: By: Matt
item.dc:creator: Matt
item.description: Wow, didn't realise so many of those games are Corona developments! There should be a promo section in the iOS App Store for "Corona SDK Built" !
item.content:encoded: Wow, didn’t realise so many of those games are Corona developments! There should be a promo section in the iOS App Store for “Corona SDK Built” !

item.title: By: Jann
item.dc:creator: Jann
item.description: @Chris: you still can compile with pro.
item.content:encoded: @Chris: you still can compile with pro.

item.title: By: Christian Mueller
item.dc:creator: Christian Mueller
item.description:
hi, again thanks. but will we , as new enterprise users, still able to also compile with the standart corona pro. I will definitly look into enterprise, but basically I will continue to compile my apps with Pro. it would be a mess should i am not be able to do so in the future, as it seems to work with enterprise is way more complex. looking for an answer.
thanks chris
item.content:encoded:
hi, again thanks.
but will we , as new enterprise users, still able to also compile with the standart corona pro. I will definitly look into enterprise, but basically I will continue to compile my apps with Pro.
it would be a mess should i am not be able to do so in the future, as it seems to work with enterprise is way more complex.
looking for an answer.

thanks
chris

item.title: By: Simon Fearby
item.dc:creator: Simon Fearby
item.description:
Dang, I renewed (31st Dec 2014) 1 day before the refund window (Jan 1st 2015).
Don't need Enterprise.
item.content:encoded:
Dang, I renewed (31st Dec 2014) 1 day before the refund window (Jan 1st 2015).

Don’t need Enterprise.
